attributes.action: Stop the Sale by Auction of Fourways Community Centre, Norwich
attributes.additional_details: For the past three years, the church has been doing all the repairs and renovations to the buildings which was left vandalised until we moved in 2014 under an agreement with the council, upgraded to a five-year lease in 2015. We are happy to buy it and serve the community.
attributes.background: Norwich City Council has put up the Fourways Community Centre for sale by public auction, despite this being used currently by our church and charity for charitable activities for us and minority groups in Norwich.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council - you can find out more here: 

https://www.norwich.gov.uk/info/20011/about_your_council/1347/petitions
